io.github.nikmang.stevecoin.crypto

Class Blockchain

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.nikmang.stevecoin.crypto.Blockchain

  • public class Blockchain
extends java.lang.Object
    The blockchain that contains all blocks. Contains utility methods for block creation, validation.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Blockchain

        public Blockchain()
        Constructor for blockchain. Initializes chain with a single genesis block created.

    • Method Detail

      • getChain

        public java.util.Deque<Block> getChain()
        Returns an unmodifiable instance of the current chain.
        Returns:
        An instance of the chain that cannot be modified.

      • addBlockToChain

        public boolean addBlockToChain(Block b)
        Attempts to add a block to the chain.
        Parameters:
        b - Block to be added.
        Returns:
        true if block was valid and added.

      • replaceChain

        public boolean replaceChain(java.util.Deque<Block> chain)
        Atempts to replace the current blockchain with the newer one. New chain validation is done within the method. Runtime O(1) with O(n) validation method.
        Parameters:
        chain - New chain to replace old one.
        Returns:
        true if chain was replaced. false if chain is either invalid or length was less or equal to current one.

      • generateNextBlock

        public Block generateNextBlock(java.lang.String data)
        Generates a new block based on current chain. Does not automatically add it to the existing chain.
        Parameters:
        data - Data to be put inside the block.
        Returns:
        Newly found block with data specified.

      • hasMatchingDifficulty

        public static boolean hasMatchingDifficulty(int difficulty,
                                            java.lang.String hash)
        Check if hash has correct difficulty attached to it.
        Parameters:
        difficulty - The difficulty of the block
        hash - The hash that is used in a potential block
        Returns:
        true if hash has applicable difficulty attached to it.

      • getDifficulty

        public int getDifficulty()
        Gets the difficulty for the next block. If time interval not exceeded will return the difficulty of the last block.
        Returns:
        Difficulty for new block.
